We are honored to consistently be named a Top Workplace by our Associates, who make a difference every day for the people, businesses, and Communities we serve. The Investment Associate is responsible for providing high-level service delivery to Investment Advisors, intermediaries, and internal clients of the Wealth Management Division (Trade Desk, IT, Audit, Trust Operations, etc.). Collaborate with Investment Advisors to monitor and oversee investment methodology across book(s) of business and client accounts. The position requires internal communications, including participation in select internal committee meetings; knowledge, understanding, and application of fiduciary and investment principles, including Reg 9 compliance requirements; knowledge of securities processing and clearing; knowledge of trust & accounting systems; knowledge of investment systems to support trading and performance analysis (First Rate and Investor's View specifically) and technology to support recordkeeping and payment history (SunGard); and interface with Trust Operations Service Partners. Job Responsibilities: Master the use of all investment management systems including, but not limited to, Investor's View, First Rate, Morningstar, Factset, and Sungard Addvantage. Act as a "go to" team member for reporting needs, system support questions, and issues. Monitor asset allocation, security selection, and liquidity needs of clients to ensure that portfolios are managed in accordance with investment policy statements and client preferences. Analyze accounts for model eligibility and work with Investment Advisors to assess capital gain/loss implications. Run and own the model adoption process by helping Investment Advisors complete model adoption documentation. Place account-specific trades in Bryn Mawr based model accounts where appropriate. Understand capital gain and loss implications. Proactively monitor overdrafts for Investment Advisors. Analyze account holdings and suggest sales to raise cash as needed. Work with investment services manager on investment-related projects such as systems conversions, performance reporting issues, process improvement initiatives, etc. Be willing and able to run assigned tasks with little to no supervision. Manage multiple time-sensitive tasks simultaneously for Investment Advisors. Those tasks include but are not limited to the preparation of retention letters for off-list holdings, preparation of investment policy statements, completion of Reg 9 investment reviews on behalf of assigned Investment Advisors, preparation and mailing of client correspondence, asset gathering, transferring money both internally and externally, paper, and electronic filing, and other administrative tasks, as needed. Coordinate client meetings for Investment Advisors and assist in meeting preparation, including pulling and reviewing client performance reports. Assemble packets for client meetings and customize them to the individual portfolio manager's needs. Act as Secretary to one or more internal committees (account review committee, discretionary distribution committee, etc.) and prepare accurate committee minutes that track exceptions. Track and report account compliance rates for Investment Advisors (expired or aged investment policy statements, investment review delinquencies, etc.). Work with Portfolio Review Committee Chair to monitor and report on the completion rate of Reg 9 investment reviews monthly. Assist in error resolution. Work with Investment Advisors to bring non-compliant portfolios in line via rebalancing the portfolio or securing documentation, as needed. Work with financial planners and assist with E-Money data entry as needed. Minimum Qualifications: A 4-year college degree in business administration, finance, or a business-related major is preferred. Knowledge, understanding, and application of fiduciary and investment principles; general knowledge of investment markets and trust administration. 3-5 years of experience in administrative client service. Knowledge of securities processing and clearing is required. Knowledge of trust & accounting systems is required. Knowledge of investment and performance management systems and technology to support recordkeeping and payment history is required. Experience with a trust accounting and/or investment system is preferred. Must be able to juggle priorities, be organized, and have an adjustable social style. Qualified candidates will exhibit initiative and the ability to complete assigned tasks efficiently and accurately. WSFS Bank is inclusive and supportive of individual needs.
